kickstart.post:
LOGFILE=/tmp/opal-install.log
#Installing java 64 bit #needed by the libdrmaa if [ `/opt/rocks/bin/rocks report version` == "5.4.3" ]; then java -version &> /tmp/testjavabefore rpm -ev --nodeps jdk.i586 rpm -ev --nodeps jdk.x86_64 rpm -Uvh --force --nodeps /export/rocks/install/rolls/base/5.4.3/x86_64/RedHat/RPMS/jdk-6u26-linux.x86_64.rpm &> /tmp/rpminstall.log java -version &> /tmp/testjavaafter fi
if [ ! -f /var/lock/subsys/mysqld ]; then /etc/init.d/mysqld start fi
/sbin/chkconfig mysqld on /usr/bin/mysqladmin create opaldb
mkpasswd -l 10 -s 0 2> /dev/null
OPAL_DB_PASS=`cat /opt/opal/etc/opal.pass` /bin/echo -en GRANT ALL PRIVILEGES ON opaldb.* TO 'opal'@'localhost' IDENTIFIED BY \'$OPAL_DB_PASS\' \; | /usr/bin/mysql
cp /opt/opal/etc/hibernate-opal.cfg.xml /opt/opal/etc/hibernate-opal.cfg.xml.hsql cp /opt/opal/etc/hibernate-opal.cfg.xml.mysql /opt/opal/etc/hibernate-opal.cfg.xml sed -i "s/opal_mysql_passwd/$OPAL_DB_PASS/" /opt/opal/etc/hibernate-opal.cfg.xml chmod go-r /opt/opal/etc/hibernate-opal.cfg.xml /bin/echo "DB setup complited" >> $LOGFILE
LoadModule jk_module modules/mod_jk.so JkWorkersFile /etc/httpd/conf/workers.properties
# Where to put jk logs JkLogFile /var/log/httpd/mod_jk.log
# Set the jk log level [debug/error/info] JkLogLevel info
# Select the log format JkLogStampFormat "[%a %b %d %H:%M:%S %Y] "
# JkOptions indicate to send SSL KEY SIZE, JkOptions +ForwardKeySize +ForwardURICompat -ForwardDirectories
# JkRequestLogFormat set the request format JkRequestLogFormat "%w %V %T"
workers.java_home=/usr/java/latest # Define 1 real worker using ajp13 worker.list=worker1 # Set properties for worker1 (ajp13) worker.worker1.type=ajp13 worker.worker1.host=localhost worker.worker1.port=8009
JkMount /opal* worker1 JkMount /app* worker1
sed -i 's/AddHandler imap-file map/#AddHandler imap-file map/g' /etc/httpd/conf/httpd.conf sed -i 's/AddHandler type-map var/#AddHandler type-map var/g' /etc/httpd/conf/httpd.conf
/etc/init.d/httpd restart
/sbin/chkconfig --add tomcat-opal
CATALINA_HOME=/opt/tomcat ls /share/opal/opal-jobs ln -s /share/opal/opal-jobs $CATALINA_HOME/webapps/opal-jobs cp /opt/opal/etc/index.html $CATALINA_HOME/webapps/opal-jobs
/bin/echo "Tomcat setup completed sucessfully " >> $LOGFILE
mv /opt/opal/etc/opal.properties /opt/opal/etc/opal.properties.orig
SERVER_NAME="&opal_public_fqdn;" if [ "$SERVER_NAME" == "" ] ; then #if this is a frontend installation the #opal_public_fqdn is not set yet SERVER_NAME="&Kickstart_PublicHostname;" fi
tomcat.url=http://$SERVER_NAME num.procs=8 mpi.run=/opt/openmpi/bin/mpirun working.dir=opal-jobs mail.enable=true mail.smtp.host=localhost mail.smtp.from=noreply@$SERVER_NAME mail.smtp.auth=false mail.smtp.debug=false mail.smtp.user=useless mail.smtp.password=useless opal.datalifetime=4 days opal.hard_limit=3600 opal.jobmanager=edu.sdsc.nbcr.opal.manager.DRMAAJobManager drmaa.pe=mpich drmaa.queue=all.q globus.gatekeeper=host:2119/jobmanager-sge globus.service_cert=/path/to/your/globus/cert globus.service_privkey=/path/to/your/globus/key globus.gridftp_base=gsiftp://host:2811/working_dir csf4.workingDir=opal_runs mpi.script=/opt/condor/etc/examples/mp1script opal.ip.processing=true opal.ip.limit=35 opal.ip.blacklist=66.102.7.104 opal.ip.whitelist=66.102.7.105, 127.0.0.1
#this is not gonna work on a post install script #proc_count=0 #if test -z /opt/gridengine; then # proc_count=`cat /proc/cpuinfo | grep "processor" | wc -l` #else # procs=`qstat -f | grep BIP | awk '{print $3}' | cut -d'/' -f3` # for i in $procs; do # proc_count=$(($proc_count + $i)) # done #fi #sed -i "s/num.procs=2/num.procs=$proc_count/" /opt/opal/etc/opal.properties
if test -z /opt/gridengine; then #no sge installed #lets use fork proc_count=`cat /proc/cpuinfo | grep "processor" | wc -l` sed -i "s/num.procs=8/num.procs=$proc_count/" /opt/opal/etc/opal.properties sed -i "s/edu.sdsc.nbcr.opal.manager.DRMAAJobManager/edu.sdsc.nbcr.opal.manager.ForkJobManager/" /opt/opal/etc/opal.properties fi
#this replace the libdrmaa with JNI api compiled in if [ "&rocks_version;" == "5.4.3" -o "&rocks_version;" == "6.0" ]; then echo Replacing libdrmaa >> $LOGFILE cp -pf /opt/opal/lib/libdrmaa.so.1.0 /opt/gridengine/lib/lx26-amd64/libdrmaa.so.1.0 fi
echo Installing opal >> $LOGFILE chown -R tomcat:tomcat /opt/opal cd /opt/opal export JAVA_HOME=/usr/java/latest export PATH=$JAVA_HOME/bin:$PATH
echo "running install opal " >> $LOGFILE /bin/su tomcat -c "/opt/rocks/bin/ant install > /opt/opal/install.log" >> $LOGFILE
FILE=$CATALINA_HOME/conf/web.xml pre=`cat -n $FILE | grep listings | grep param-name | awk '{print $1}'` num=`expr $pre + 1` sed -i "${num} s/false/true/" $FILE
#!/bin/bash
# Removes old opal job directories older then default days
CATALINA_HOME=/opt/tomcat # default number of days to keep job direcotry n=7
#cd $CATALINA_HOME/webapps/opal-jobs cd $CATALINA_HOME/webapps/ROOT dirs=`find . -type d -name 'app*' -mtime +$n -print` for i in $dirs do rm -rf $i done
sleep 5 /etc/init.d/tomcat-opal start sleep 10
/bin/su tomcat -c "/opt/opal/deployed/deploy.sh" &> /tmp/opal-deploy.log
echo "Opal setup completed sucesfully" >> $LOGFILE
